001package org.opt4j.optimizers.ea.aeseh;
002
003import java.util.Collection;
004import java.util.HashSet;
005import java.util.Set;
006
007import org.opt4j.core.Individual;
008import org.opt4j.optimizers.ea.Selector;
009
010import com.google.inject.Inject;
011import com.google.inject.Singleton;
012
013/**
014 * The {@link EpsilonSamplingSelector} implements a selection process based on
015 * the Îµ-sampling.
016 * 
017 * @author Fedor Smirnov
018 *
019 */
020@Singleton
021public class EpsilonSamplingSelector implements Selector {
022
023        protected final ESamplingSurvivorGeneration survivorGeneration;
024
025        /**
026         * Basic constructor
027         * 
028         * @param survivorGeneration
029         *            the {@link ESamplingSurvivorGeneration} used for picking the
030         *            {@link Individual}s that will survive and act as potential
031         *            parents
032         */
033        @Inject
034        public EpsilonSamplingSelector(ESamplingSurvivorGeneration survivorGeneration) {
035                this.survivorGeneration = survivorGeneration;
036        }
037
038        @Override
039        public Collection<Individual> getParents(int mu, Collection<Individual> population) {
040                // Does nothing. In the AeSeH algorithm, all survivors are considered as
041                // possible
042                // parents.
043                return population;
044        }
045
046        @Override
047        public Collection<Individual> getLames(int lambda, Collection<Individual> population) {
048                int survivorNumber = population.size() - lambda;
049                Set<Individual> survivors = survivorGeneration.getSurvivors(population, survivorNumber);
050                Set<Individual> lames = new HashSet<>(population);
051                lames.removeAll(survivors);
052                return lames;
053        }
054
055        @Override
056        public void init(int maxsize) {
057                // Does nothing.
058        }
059}
